abstract.text: A query that returns a snapshot of all matching documents currently saved in the HealthKit store.

inlineContent.text: object to search for documents in the HealthKit store. You can provide a predicate to filter the search results, a sort order for the returned samples, or even a limit to the number of samples returned.
Document queries are immutable: The query’s properties are set when the query is first created. They cannot change.
To create and execute a query, perform the following steps:

abstract.text: A definition of logical conditions for constraining a search for a fetch or for in-memory filtering.
An immutable description of how to order a collection of objects according to a property common to all the objects.

Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A query that returns a snapshot of all matching documents currently saved in the HealthKit store.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the sample includes the full document’s data.
Instantiates and returns a document query.
The maximum number of documents the receiver will return upon completion.
An array of sort descriptors that specify the order of the results returned by this query.
A value indicating that the query returns all the matching samples in the HealthKit store.
An abstract superclass with subclasses that identify a specific type of data for the HealthKit store.
Returns the shared document type for the provided identifier.
An abstract class for all the query classes in HealthKit.
The type of record returned by a verifiable clinical record query.
A query for one-time access to a SMART Health Card or EU Digital COVID Certificate.
A query interface that provides one-time access to a SMART Health Card or EU Digital COVID Certificate using Swift concurrency.
The source type for the verifiable clinical record.
Use queries to request sample data from HealthKit.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.

A type that can be compared for value equality.

A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
